item.description:
South and Middle Moats
Join Dennis P for a "last minute" hike up and back to South Moat and
onto Middle Moat from Dugway Road in Conway NH for a day in the
sun with great views in 3-1/2 directions.


This is favorite local hike in the Conway area on sunny winter days as the
majority of the route is in the sun.
The book time is about 5 hours round trip.

The meeting location will not be at the trailhead, but rather will be at the Shopping Plaza parking lot on RT 302 in Conway NH on the left immediately after you cross the Saco river.

This should reduce the number of folks who have to buy a WMNF parking pass and ensure that everyone can find their way to the trailhead via a couple of confusing local roads.

A stop by the local Mexican restaurant after the hike is
optional (but recommended!).

A 9 am start time should get us
back by 2:30 to 3 PM.

I would like to have three other folks commit to this hike by Friday evening.

Despite the potentially sunny conditions, snowshoes and traction aids (stabilicers or equivalent) are required as it still mid February. Sunglasses and appropriate layers are recommended, as typically the hike starts out cold but warms up quickly. Be prepared to have a way of attaching your snowshoes
to your pack as they may not be needed all day. There is a distinct possibility that sliding down the trail will be part of the fun on the descent so nylon pants are recommended.

The total distance is 6 miles round trip and about 1800 feet of elevation. The pace will be steady but matched to the abilities of the group.

Just in case someone does try to go to the trailhead, realize that Dugway road is not typically plowed west of the trailhead, despite the insistence of some mapping programs that it is passable!.
item.how_to_find_us: Dennis P is your hike leader cell phone Saturday 603-986-3818
item.name: South and Middle Moats
